QqWAFrxLEumbqZaFjtuicA.text: Very delicious, although a little too much sugar for my taste. If you are a Nutella lover then this is the place for you.  We have the peanut butter crepe and the fruit waffle, quite delicious. It's definitely worth the try. Also it was very convenient for the time of day we went (around 2030).

photos.caption: Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crepe, peanut butter with Nutella and banana

NkX5IzSWgHwUQIyfhTM4Pg.text: Absolutely delicious and delightful, great environment, lovely staff, incredibly yummy latte and treats, two thumbs way way up.

photos.caption: Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Wn9sq2eoMnHU-Duki1EZEw.text: Just craving chocolate crepe, while this fit the bill I agree with others that it could be better. I ordered dark chocolate with fresh raspberries, which was a good amount of. It's just crepe was chewy and dry. Winter red tea was very nice with it though. Would not go back though... would try elsewhere...

photos.caption: Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Hpw6N8k07D5yTskCeHsbpQ.text: Absolutely delicious. I had the Afogatto coffee (espresso with a scoop of ice cream) and my friend and I split the Caramel Shortbread waffle. Best waffle ever, better than my Belgian waffle experience! The sandwich we had beforehand was also very good and healthy, combatting the large amount of sugar following it. This place is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Coro Chocolate - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

EgCIOzrxpMuURMVcDP1J7g.text: A relaxed chocolate shop. Good food, everything chocolate. Chocolate pancakes, chocolate waffles, hot chocolate, get the picture.

xYoqw0XoFto4ktvu6SM20w.text: Had chocolate cake and crepe. The cake was unfortunately pretty dry. Granted, we went close to closing time.  Crepe was okay, but nothing extraordinary
